required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Neuromuscular Electrical Stimulation For The Treatment of Diabetic Peripheral Neuropathy
clinical_study.official_title: Neuromuscular Electrical Stimulation For The Treatment of Diabetic Peripheral Neuropathy

brief_summary.textblock: Diabetic peripheral neuropathy is a disabling condition, which is characterized by numbness, hypersensitivity or pain in the extremities. The cause is thought to be due to damaged nerves due to poor circulation. A new therapy option has recently become available to increase blood flow in the legs. The aim of this study is to assess if it is possible to improve or resolve symptoms of diabetic peripheral neuropathy in patients by improving the blood supply to the legs.

primary_outcome.description: Two component, single outcome - Any Improvement in nerve conduction parameters compared to baseline of the tested sensory nerves at 6 months. Change in conduction velocities compared to baseline of the peroneal motor nerve

secondary_outcome.description: Berg Balance Scale Questionnaire is a 14-item disease specific questionnaire (scoring up to 56) assessing elements of balance, with each element scoring 0-4.

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of Life Questionnaires - EuroQol 5 Domain Quality of Life Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: EuroQol 5 Domain Quality of Life (EQ-5D QOL) questionnaire will provide assessment of the participants quality of life (EQ-5D QOL from 0-1).
Arterial Blood flow assessed by ultrasound, utilising standard Haemodynamics assessment.
NTSS-6 Questionnaire is a 6 item questionnaire, scoring a maximum of 3.66 per item with a maximum score of 21.96. This grades neuropathy symptomatology.
This will be assessed using a Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) to assess individual pain scores.
Michigan Neuropathy Screening Instrument is a patient (15 questions) and clinician (5 questions) completed questionnaire that allows assessment of neuropathy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of Life Questionnaires - EuroQol Visual Analogue Scale
secondary_outcome.description: Euroqol Visual Analogue Scale (EQ5D VAS) will provide assessment of the participants quality of life (EQ5D VAS from 0-100).

arm_group.description: 12 Months of Sham Comparator (Sham Revitive Medic Neuromuscular Stimulation Device).

arm_group.arm_group_label: Group B1 - Active Comparator & Active Comparator
arm_group.description: Active Comparator for 6 months (Revitive Medic Neuromuscular Stimulation Device). Then randomisation into active comparator (Revitive Medic Neuromuscular Stimulation Device) for further 6 months.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Group B2 - Active Comparator & Sham Comparator
arm_group.description: Active Comparator for 6 months (Revitive Medic Neuromuscular Stimulation Device). Then randomisation into sham comparator (Sham Revitive Medic Neuromuscular Stimulation Device) for further 6 months.

intervention.description: Twice daily use (2 x 30 minute sessions) of the footplate neuromuscular stimulation device (Revitive Medic).
intervention.arm_group_label: Group B1 - Active Comparator & Active Comparator
Group B2 - Active Comparator & Sham Comparator

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of diabetes mellitus on best medical therapy.
- Diagnosis of diabetic peripheral neuropathy base on a validated screening questionnaire (Michigan Neuropathy Screening Instrument) score of >6 and nerve conduction study
- Aged 18+.
- Capacity to provide informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Lacks capacity to provide informed consent.
- Pregnant. Participants must be of non-childbearing age potential or using adequate contraception for the duration of the study period and have a negative urine pregnancy test
- Has a cardiac pacemaker, or other defibrillator device.
- Has current foot ulceration.
- Has other cause of peripheral neuropathy

overall_official.last_name: Alun H Davies, MA DM DSC FRCS FEBVS

overall_contact.last_name: Tristan R A Lane, MBBS BSc FRCS PhD
